poem:
### Improvised Alchemy

Panic-knead morning clouds to dough,  
whirlwind wisps of green, a hint  
of salmon swirled in silver streams,  
tart joy of yoghurt's cool embrace.  
No need for loaves; in haste we birth  
these humble discs, the hero's part  
in breakfasts warm and unconfined,  
as sky blurs with rising bread.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. If I have forgotten to pick up a loaf, I will often panic-make them for breakfast or packed lunches. While they are great on the side of stews, soups and curries (or on the barbecue, if that’s the way the weather is going), I’ve made them the hero in". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
